Module mesakit.graph.core
Package com.telenav.mesakit.graph.specifications.common.vertex.store

Class ConnectivityStore

java.lang.Object
com.telenav.mesakit.graph.specifications.common.vertex.store.ConnectivityStore
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.esotericsoftware.kryo.KryoSerializable, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.code.TripwireTrait, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.lifecycle.Initializable, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.naming.NamedObject, com.telenav.kivakit.primitive.collections.CompressibleCollection, com.telenav.kivakit.validation.Validatable
public class ConnectivityStore extends Object implements com.telenav.kivakit.validation.Validatable, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.naming.NamedObject, com.esotericsoftware.kryo.KryoSerializable, com.telenav.kivakit.primitive.collections.CompressibleCollection, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.lifecycle.Initializable, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.code.TripwireTrait
Stores lists of "in", "out" and two-way edges are added during loading with temporary* methods and then stored by vertex index with storeTemporaryLists(int). Information can be retrieved in several ways:

Counts

  • retrieveEdgeCount(int)
  • retrieveInEdgeCount(int)
  • retrieveOutEdgeCount(int)
  • retrieveTwoWayEdgeCount(int)

Edge Sets

  • retrieveInEdges(int)
  • retrieveOutEdges(int)

Sequences

  • retrieveEdgeSequence(int)
  • retrieveInEdgeSequence(int)
  • retrieveOutEdgeSequence(int)
  • retrieveTwoWayEdgeSequence(int)

A variety of methods starting with "temporary" are used to temporarily store connectivity information while loading data. These collections are discarded once the store is populated with edge lists.

Author:
jonathanl (shibo)

      public void storeTemporaryLists(int vertexIndex)

    • temporaryConnect

      public void temporaryConnect(Edge edge, int fromVertexIndex, int toVertexIndex)
      Assigns a connection from the "from" vertex to the "to" vertex for the given edge, taking into account its road state (one-way or two-way). This connection is temporary during edge loading and is discarded once connectivity has been finalized.

    • temporaryDisconnect

      public void temporaryDisconnect(Edge edge, int fromVertexIndex, int toVertexIndex)
      Detaches "in" and "out" and two-way edges from the "from" and "to" vertexes in the appropriate way, depending on the road state. This method is called when an edge is removed.

    • temporaryIsConnected

      public boolean temporaryIsConnected(int fromVertexIndex, int toVertexIndex)
      Returns:
      True if the given "from" and "to" vertex identifiers are connected
